snippet: The Justice Department is threatening to sue Apple and five big publishers over a pricing model for electronic books that it says constitutes collusion and violates antitrust laws.
abstract: The Justice Department is threatening to sue Apple and five big publishers over a pricing model for electronic books that it says constitutes collusion and violates antitrust laws.

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and EDWARD WYATT

headline.main: Government Pressuring Publishers to Adjust Pricing Policy on E-Books
headline.print_headline: For Publishers, Pressure Builds on E-Book Pricing
